message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.HC 

The paper focuses on human action recognition in video, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a new descriptor based on convolutional neural networks, which suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves the use of both automatically estimated and manually annotated human poses, which could be relevant to the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper's focus on human action recognition could also be relevant to the sub-category cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
